intro: Biophytum antioquiense, commonly known as the Antioquian false heather, is a flowering plant native to Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. The plant has a sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in horticultural trade.
